column1: What do you call a cow that just gave birth? de-calf-einated
column3: In the context of the joke, calf means both a young cow and the lower part of a persons leg.
column4: The calf was cute as it followed its mother in the pasture.
column5: After running for a long time, I felt a strain in my calf.

column1: How did the mother banana spoil the baby banana? she left him out in the sun too long.
column3: In the context of the joke, spoil can mean to ruin something or to go bad (like food).
column4: The milk began to spoil after being left out of the refrigerator.
column5: The childs behavior can spoil if they are not taught discipline.

column1: How can a line be both short and long? its a long line of midgets!
column3: The word line refers to a queue (short) and also refers to a geometric concept (long).
column4: The children stood in line for their turn on the playground slide.
column5: A straight line is the shortest distance between two points.

column1: How do you make a sheep jump off a cliff? put a redneck behind it.
column3: The word jump can mean to leap into the air or to spring into action.
column4: The athlete was able to jump over the high bar during the competition.
column5: I always jump at the chance to help a friend in need.

column1: What do you call a drum that causes problems? a conundrum.
column3: The word drum refers to a musical instrument and can also refer to a tumultuous or difficult situation (figurative use).
column4: The drummer played a lively beat during the concert.
column5: I found myself in a drum of trouble after missing the deadline.
